body:
@robertmeta 
I don't understand your question. I don't want to change how vanity import paths work, but when canonical paths are enforced.

For the user (terminology above) the current behavior is perfectly fine.
But since the developer can't push to "gopkg.in/metakeule/loop.v1"
he will have to manually clone or add an external.

But that is not the point, since you would have to manually clone anyway.
The point is however, that you have to do this for every version and that all tools that
rely on a package path (e.g. editor, IDE, yadda yadda) also have to switch the path.

For some of them symlinks might work, but since the go commands don't support symlinks you are out of luck if any of the tools use the go commands.

That are not red herrings but so many different consequences that are problematic.
